sentences.english: It didn't look very modern; the houses were huge and old looking.
sentences.chinese: 那看起来不怎么现代，房子很大很古旧。

sentences.english: And old instruments often have a history that adds to their lustre.
sentences.chinese: 而古旧乐器又有着一段历史让其熠熠生辉，锦上添花。

sentences.english: On the ground floor some old murals have survived.
sentences.chinese: 在底层，有一些古旧的壁画。

sentences.english: Today's approval of new drugs in the international community needs to carry out the raw data transmission.
sentences.chinese: 如古旧药的审批须要反在邦际间入行本初数据的传输。

sentences.english: There are many warehouses of antique furniture in Sanjianfang.
sentences.chinese: 三间房有很多仓储式古旧家具仓库。

sentences.english: Often with fake chemical etching method to produce color Qin old jade.
sentences.chinese: 作伪者往往用化学腐蚀的方法制作出古玉古旧的沁色。

sentences.english: The Beijing Panjiayuan Flea Market is the most popular antique market in China.
sentences.chinese: 潘家园旧货市场是全国人气最旺的古旧物品市场。

sentences.english: The aisle was floored with ancient bricks.
sentences.chinese: 过道由古旧的砖块铺就。

sentences.english: Sanjianfang Antique Furniture Street under construction.
sentences.chinese: 兴建中的三间房古旧家具街。

sentences.english: Some experts say they are modern-day victims of an antiquated system.
sentences.chinese: 一些专家说他们是一个古旧制度的现代牺牲者。

sentences.english: The long street stretches a few thousand meters.
sentences.chinese: 古旧家具的长街，连起来有几千米。

sentences.english: The one with the old gargoyles.
sentences.chinese: 有着古旧的怪兽滴水嘴的那个。

sentences.english: Even seems to yellow in the sun, like the color of the ancient books.
sentences.chinese: 连照进来的阳光都似乎昏黄，如同古旧书籍的颜色。

sentences.english: Well, next to her house is an old cemetery.
sentences.chinese: 在她所居住的房屋旁是一片古旧的墓地。

definition: simple and unadorned (of art, architecture etc)
interesting and appealing (of old locations, objects etc)
variant of 斑駁|斑驳[ban1 bo2]
mottled and peeling off in places
road or pavement laid with flagstones
